headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Offers No Clear Answer in Samsung-Apple Patent Case

abstract: Supreme Court unanimously rules Samsung may not have to pay $399 million in damages for copying specific elements of Apple iPhone design; justices decline to give clear answer to case, except to affirm that liability in design patent cases can apply to entire product or components, forcing Apple and Samsung to go back to court to settle on appropriate amount of damages.
snippet: A unanimous court ruled on Tuesday that Samsung may not have to pay $399 million in damages for copying parts of the iPhone’s distinctive look....

abstract: European Commission extends Google's deadline to answer claims that it favored its own comparison shopping search over those of rivals until end of August; European officials and antitrust lawyers say company's move to reorganize its business units under new name Alphabet will not affect antitrust case.
snippet: The move comes just days before an Aug. 17 deadline that Europe’s competition authorities had set for Google to respond to the accusations....

lead_paragraph: Companies like Addepar are using data-filtering techniques honed at spy agencies to help track and value clients’ diverse holdings.

headline.main: Wealth Managers Enlist Spy Tools to Map Portfolios
headline.print_headline: Wealth Managers Enlist Spy Tools to Map Portfolios

abstract: Companies like Addepar are using techniques developed at spy agencies to track and value investments in diverse portfolios, helping determine value and whether or not they are headed for crash; professional wealth managers and wealthy individuals now have access to more data at their fingertips, showing them exactly what they own and what they are worth.
snippet: Companies like Addepar are using data-filtering techniques honed at spy agencies to help track and value clients’ diverse holdings....

lead_paragraph: The investigation is the latest hurdle for Amazon and other American tech giants as European policy makers pursue antitrust, tax and other inquiries.

headline.main: Amazon’s E-Books Business Investigated by European Antitrust Regulators
headline.print_headline: Amazon’s E-Book Business Being Investigated in Europe

abstract: European Commission will begin antitrust investigation into whether Amazon abused its e-book market position to favor its own products; move represents latest hurdle for tech giants on the Continent, and marks stark reversal for Amazon, which just three years earlier had called for antitrust investigation into Apple on similar charges in the American e-book market.
snippet: The investigation is the latest hurdle for Amazon and other American tech giants as European policy makers pursue antitrust, tax and other inquiries....

lead_paragraph: The agreement would let businesses like Google and Facebook continue to move personal data across the Atlantic, but European privacy officials may balk.

headline.main: U.S. and Europe in ‘Safe Harbor’ Data Deal, but Legal Fight May Await
headline.print_headline: Deal Struck to Balance U.S.-Europe Data Fears

abstract: European Union officials reach agreement with United States that will allow companies to continue moving customers' digital data back and forth between continents; deal is result of months of often tense negotiations that pitted individuals' privacy concerns against those of national security.
